definition: to expose/to reveal
surname Zhan
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

sentences.english: Is no substitute for showing off the core of her unique style.
sentences.chinese: 是否展露了無可取代的獨特風格纔是核心所在。

sentences.english: She shows herself naked in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 她就像在空中展露自己的裸體。

sentences.english: Under the hot lights, my bad girl side really came out.
sentences.chinese: 在熱情的燈光下，壞女孩兒的一面充分地展露出來了。

sentences.english: She showed great skill in winning the hearts of the students.
sentences.chinese: 她在贏得學生歡心方面展露出高超的技巧。

sentences.english: "Logos He goes on. "But logos," he writes, " "serves to reveal the advantageous and the harmful.
sentences.chinese: 也繼續寫到，主要是爲展露出利害關係。

sentences.english: A happy smile spread over his broad, priest -like face.
sentences.chinese: 他那張寬闊的教士般虔誠的臉上展露出愉快的笑容。

sentences.english: Mozart showed genius even at the age of six, when he began to compose minutes.
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特六歲時開始創作小步舞曲，展露才華。

sentences.english: It helps manifesting patience, tolerance and tact.
sentences.chinese: 有助於展露你的耐心，忍耐和技能。

sentences.english: In the recent air war over Libya it demonstrated its attack capabilities.
sentences.chinese: 在最近利比亞的戰爭中也展露了其空中打擊能力。

sentences.english: He's still in that awkward phase of unreadiness and under preparation.
sentences.chinese: 他當時還處於一種不願展露文學才華的時期。

sentences.english: He endured unfounded, malicious anger in order to save you.
sentences.chinese: 他爲了拯救你而承受了你尚未展露的，惡毒的怨恨。

sentences.english: I had never before seen such a display of genuine emotion from my countrymen.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒見過我的同胞們如此展露自己真實的情感。

sentences.english: There’s nothing more rewarding than putting smiles on the faces around you.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼事情比向你身邊的人展露微笑更有益的了。

sentences.english: His genius as a painter flowered very early.
sentences.chinese: 他的繪畫天賦很早就展露出來。

sentences.english: He was a deeply serious musician who had shown his brilliance very early.
sentences.chinese: 他是個很嚴肅的音樂家，很早就展露出非凡的才華。

definition: to become visible/to reveal
completely/fully/without omission
to appear/to come out in the open
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to display (one's potential, one's talents etc)
to show in full light/to be revealed in its entirety
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to expose/to bare
to lay bare/to come to light
to cover all at one glance (idiom)/a panoramic view
to express/to exhibit
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
be plainly visible
to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
hidden/covered/concealed
to expose/to reveal/to lay bare/also pr. [pu4 lu4]
